title: Hospital Policy
body:
Very disappointed to be initially refused treatment after declining to wear a face covering at the Heywood walk in centre today.

NHS frontline staff are under unfair pressure having to enforce this Trust policy which has no scientific basis or medical grounds for implementation. Ill fitting paper masks have been shown, in many RCT's, to have virtually no impact on the spread of SARS-COV-2.

After being sent back to the waiting room, I was eventually triaged by a different member of staff who advised that they  did not have the facilities to attend to my ailment and sent me back to the A&E dept at UHNM. Funny, but staff at A&E had just redirected me to the Heywood in the first place. Needless to say, I didn't bother going back to A&E.

Come on senior management, scrap this mask mandate. Hardly anyone is wearing them outside an NHS setting. You have just made a very anxious patient with a potentially life changing serious health concern very worried about getting treatment elsewhere in the NHS.

readBy.name: Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent Partnership NHS Trust

title: brilliant and responsive as ever
body: Easy to contact, helpful reception staff and rapid response from Doctor to arrange sample and  with prescription sent straight to pharmacy. Could not be faulted

title: Never register here
body: They forgot my prescription request. They forgot my appointments. They have a wrong record about my medication plan. Staff give me different information every time I called. Sometimes they give me wrong information. My treatment plan was delay. My physical and mental health was worsened because I had to wait for a very long time and it was very hard to make things happen.

title: Practice in the wrong place, to small, needs to…
body:
The Colwall surgery, could move to the old primary school site, it is larger and extended there would be more parking extended building could accommodate more of the increasing number of Colwall residents and could be a health centre covering many needs for the local community.
Rather than loosing them to Ledbury, extended would be ideal.
A compromise facility for example,  Pharmacy, Physiotherapy, Dental Surgery.
Please consider this option and make the OLD survey HOUSING.
Regards James and Carol Smith Colwall Green.

title: Excellent practice
body:
A very well organised GP practice making sure the patients get the best possible care , advice ,treatment and care at all times in our cases .
Highly recommended.
The Director of the practice has years of experience to refer patients to the appropriate specialists.
Thank You.

title: Useless no privacy and confidentiality
body: Can’t see a male dr to discuss male problems and the secretary needs to know every single detail so they discus it with there colleagues and whomever is listening in as I’ve witnessed this myself if they are qualified to deal with my problems then why are they sitting behind a desk what happened to private and confidential I just want an appointment not an interrogation

title: Bad practice
body: I took my mum to hospital. She has been seen by first by nurse  very quick. Then we have been waited over 5 hours not seen the doctor.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Fully booked
body:
What's the point of trying to use Livi if it's always fully booked , just another complete waste of time and money 
It's about time these doctors realise they are in a "service industry " yes because that's what it is ,and they actually do some work for the great salary they receive.on the few occasions I manage to see a a doctor ,because they claim they are so busy, the waiting room is akin the the Marie Celeste i.e deserted and of 5 surgeries only one is working So where are all these doctors ,that are so overworked ?? Spending their earnings .........if they all worked a 5 day week and 37.5 hrs like us working class plebs there would be no waiting times and no need for that white elephant LIVI

title: Best Treatment & Support
body: After many years of trying, I finally found the right doctor at the right practice to give me the right support and after 6 months I have reversed my type 2 diabetes. The personal, humane approach by this young doctor was absolutely superb. Thank you Chartfield Surgery.

title: Efficient service
body: Waiting time from referral to first appointment and subsequent treatment only a matter of a few weeks. Information prior to and following surgery good. Staff friendly and supportive.

title: Amazing care
body: The Maternity team were absolutely amazing. Created a completely relaxed and caring environment to give birth in. The facilities were brilliant and the knowledgeable and caring midwife's made the experience brilliant.

title: Great surgery
body:
I have been a patient with this practice for many, many years and have had reason to use them intermittently. My health over the past year has been very testing so I have welcomed the response from the surgery in how I’ve been treated and indeed, the NHS in general.
The receptionists have always been polite and accommodating, the doctors helpful and professional. I genuinely don’t know where I’d be without this level of care.
I am glad I have remained with Islip Manor Medical Centre and appreciate what they do, especially during the pandemic where under considerable pressure.
I thank them for all their hard work, they deserve the praise.

title: Excellent practice with caring doctors!
body: Simply outstanding practice! Using it for the last 14 years! There were few new comers who let down once in a while, but mostly amazing doctors. Recently, I have been looked after by the most fantastic, caring, competent doctor while dealing with some emotional issues. I hope she knows I am talking about her. Thank you. Reception staff are mostly compassionate and accomodating. Well done guys.

title: Excellent service
body:
Had three consecutive daily trips from Lincoln to set up Home Video EEG Telemetry.
Please thank everyone involved for the care and attention given, from Reception and Porters escorting me to the correct floor, to the Nurse who installed electrodes and recorder, and were very helpful when we requested help over the phone later.
Thank you.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Perfect service
body:
Want to thank dolphin ward for looking after my daughter and giving us the best care they could.
My night Nurse amie was absolutely amazing I couldn’t of got through such a hard time without having you look after my little girl.
Amazing nurse.

title: Nice staff and service in this gp
body: Can ı say to whom is incharge many thanks to the male you have working at your reception front desk. His professional and positive attitude whilst dealing with patients either on the phone or face to face is tremendous. Your kindness and willingness to help bring comfort to many that need it and appreciate it. Whenever I've dealt with you it's been nothing but pleasant and ive witnessed this. Thank you!

title: Very efficient A and E service
body:
I was made an appointment through111 with major incidents and couldn't fault the excellent service I received.

I was seen almost immediately for vital tests and then by a lovely doctor that was very thorough and understanding. He organised  a prescription for me and sent it to my nearest pharmacy. The whole service was amazing. Thank you so much and bravo to the NHS!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Chaotic practice
body: I attended for a scan not as a patient on their books and I observed the following; unfriendly receptionist, deeply untidy everywhere, signage that made no sense. The place seemed really neglected and whilst the scan practitioner was pleasant, I was distracted by the sheer mess of the place. A good manager is needed at The Spitalfields Practice.

title: Urgent care
body:
Was given an appointment by 111 to attend the urgent care centre. 

Appointment was several hours late, with no updates as to why.  What was frustrating was ‘walk in’s’ been triaged much faster. 

When I finally met with the clinician, there was no apology for their tardiness.  The clinician was very abrupt, lacked any bedside manner and seemed to have no compassion for ill patients. 

The clinician was asking about my medical history, spanning several years and made their frustrations apparent when I could not answer questions about past medications from 15 years ago.  Kept repeating the same questions over and over several times. 

Finally The clinician, put dye in my eye, to check my eye.  But then left me with no tissue or the ability to clean my face, leaving my face dyed orange.

title: Good service
body:
Have been at this practice since we moved here 8 years ago.  Phone answered quickly and doctors ring back.
I submitted an econsult at 4.30 pm and doctor messaged me at 10.00 next day to see me later in the day.  Reassured and know the way forward.

title: Exceptional care
body: From my initial phone call to the face to face appointment with the clinician, the care and efficiency at this surgery was superb. I rang at 8am and by 10.30am my little girl had been seen at the surgery and prescribed antibiotics. We are so lucky to have such an amazing service in this community.

title: Total satisfaction from a brilliant team
body:
Referred to CGH for prostrate cancer and removal by Robot Assisted surgery of the prostrate. Consultants in Hereford identified problem and sources of action.
Pre Op assessment carried out by very friendly and helpful staff who explained everything in great detail giving me confidence in what the future held. 
Return a week before Op for blood test - once again great staff and service was in and out in 15 minutes.
OP carried out 13/5/2022 ( Friday 13th but luckily for me being cared for by a great team) - Admitted to the Kemerton Suite at 0730 - checked over and paper work discussed with a very nice chap - spoken to by the registrar and the consultant - made to feel safe secure and personally for me I knew I was dealing with people who not only knew their jobs but cared about me .
Next it was into the Anaesthetic Room ,and what a great bunch of people once again everything explained and this only helped to reinforce my confidence all would go well (unfortunately because of being under General Anaesthetic,I can only thank the operating personnel ,they did a cracking job and my recovery is going well) - 
Woke up in Snowshill Ward and that was an uplifting time,every single person I had contact with was caring ,happy and fully focused on their work,and rightly proud of the work they do - if the NHS needs to show it self at its best then this is the ward which should represent it. The ward itself is in need of a little TLC ,but the staff work round any issues - the food and catering services are excellent ( my only complaint is the Custurd Creams fail when dunked) - hopefully my treatment has been successful - if however I have to return to Hospital ,returning to CGH would be a pleasure, and I would be returning in the sure knowledge that a great team is there to provide a ,safe,,caring and professional service,delivered with a cheerful and Happy disposition. Thanks to all at CGH you are all a shining example of our great NHS.

title: Doctor lovely, Connect Health terrible
body:
I have been treated for Undifferentiated Connective Tissue Disorder (UCTD) since September 2019, and my treatment has been via Connect Health on the NHS.

The service from Connect Health has been astonishingly poor, with the shining exception of the doctor I see in person 1-2 times per year. She has been consistently helpful, sympathetic and is a great rheumatologist who I would recommend to anyone.

Sadly, even her great treatment can’t make up for how bad Connect Health has been. I summarise the 3 biggest problems below.

1. There appears to be no communication between Connect Health and Herts Valleys NHS Trust. I was not actually told after my first appointment that I was being treated via Connect Health - indeed, most staff at St Albans City Hospital seem entirely unaware this contract exists, or that someone with an autoimmune disease might be under Connect Health (CH) care. This resulted in a farcical few weeks where I rang the hospital regarding future appointments and tests, and was told the hospital had not seen me since 2012! Why are appointments via CH at the hospital apparently going unrecorded by the hospital? Why are patients not being told we need to contact CH, not the hospital, regarding our care?
2. CH are poor at updating my GP about what is going on with my care. They often do not send them my test results. When they do send them, they often send them to my old GP, where I have made clear to them I am no longer registered. When I ring CH to ask for my (routine, regular) test results, they often refuse to give me them or even to read them out to me on the phone, saying I need a doctor to interpret them. I am a 26 year old adult woman who has these tests twice a year at least. We are testing for the same things each time and I understand what the results mean by now. It is deeply patronising that the powers that be at CH will not provide me with my own healthcare data. I know that other services provide this, as my husband also has an autoimmune disease that requires him to undergo regular blood tests, and he is sent his results directly after each one without issue.
3. CH often seem confused about who I am and intermittently can’t find my records when I ring them up. They are also bad at booking my appointments - in summer 2021 I was told I would not be seen by my Dr until early 2022. In September 2021, I got a letter from the NHS asking why I had missed my appointment that week. I had missed it because CH had made me one without telling me! The letter I was then sent about my rescheduled appointment in Feb 2022 had the wrong time on it, so Watford Hospital were very confused when I turned up. Telephone appointments during Covid were also of poor quality - I was allocated several very nice physios to speak to who were, rightly, honest that they couldn’t comment on UCTD because they are not rheumatologists. While this is not their fault, it meant the appointments became pointless chats about my health with some nice strangers!

title: Awful Experience
body: Attended A & E after a very frightening experience of loss of sight and balance while at work  was sent to Eye Emergency who were very good and checked my eyes thoroughly no issues found back to A & E to be practically dismissed by the triage nurse, then told to wait to be taken to MDU, while waiting heard 2 nurses talk about me in front of all waiting, arrived at MDU to see that the waiting time for a junior Dr was 8 hours and a senior doctor 20 hours after 3 hours waiting all relatives were told to leave the waiting area, I wasn't comfortable to be left on my own in case the situation happened again. I left with my husband and will try to get a GP appointment, still no idea what caused the issue and then to receive a text asking me to tell them about my experience- not impressed.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Awful
body:
Was asked by my sons social worker and paediatrician to send referral for my son to CAHMS due to mental health.  I was told he did not fall into category to  be referred and that as he had not taken any action to seek other avenues.  The following day I was told to go back and ask for referral to be made again.  Again I was told that having a melt down or challenging behaviour will not make CAHMS see him. My son has ADHD challenging behaviour anxiety and low mood and attachment disorder. My son has said he does not want to be here he has had enough he feels sad and empty inside.  I was again told to look at other avenues.  I contacted CAHMS myself and my son is on record with them as he has self harmed in the past.  They informed me if a referral was made he would be triaged and seen by someone.  I again asked for a referral on ask my GP as that seems to be the only way of communication these days.  I had a response saying a doctor will be in contact in 3 to 10 days regarding this and if I needed help to call Samaritans or 999.
I have been with the practice 27 years and I have to say over the last few years its awful.  To have that attitude to a child with Mental Health problems im sorry but it is disgusting.

Not only that I asked for a GP to call me on a health issue as soon as possible that was 3 days ago.  Still waiting.  I am now on hold and have been for 20 mins waiting to speak to reception.

author: Fynness
title: Struggling to get a GP appointment
body: Really struggling to get a GP appointment, when are GPS going to go back to normal, as covid is largely over. I have to telephone at 8am which is difficult, as I am travelling to work. I was given a telephone appointment this afternoon, no one has called me and the appointment has now gone from patient access, I've tried phoning the GP no joy, no one is answering. Sick of it.

author: taurusqx96
title: Mixed experience of coil removed & one refitted
body:
The location is good & previous to my appointment I called in the clinic to try & book an appointment because my coil removal/refit had been put back due to covid. The reception staff were extremely helpful & friendly, they took my details & gave me a date for the nurse/GP to ring me, they nurse/GP called on the day time given & she was extremely helpful, explained everything that would happen & told me I would be rung with an appointment within 4-6 weeks, as promised I got a call with an appointment within 4 weeks, everything was extremely efficient.  
I went for my appointment at the clinic & again the reception staff were very polite, friendly & helpful.  
The doctor called me for my appointment, again very efficient, I only waited 10 minutes.  
The doctor did not introduce them self as we walked to the clinic room. They checked my details when we got to the clinic & checked that I was in for coil removal/refit.  
The doctor then went to fetch the nurse/chaperone to assist them, the nurse came in on their own, set up the equipment ready & asked me to undress behind the curtain, she was polite & friendly & introduced herself when she came into the room.  
As the procedure started the doctor gave me little warning when coil was going to be removed, the nurse started it explain, but the doctor had already started & I felt unprepared to say the least.  
Having only ever had a coil fitted & not removed before, I did not expect to be the amount of pain.  
The doctor was just telling me to relax & said they were struggling to continue because I wasn’t relaxed. The doctor did go on to explain the rest of the procedure.  
But as I left I felt I had to apologise for being in pain. The nurse explained this can happen when a coil has been in 5 years plus, & our bodies change.  
I just felt after I left & reflected on it that the doctor did not have a pleasant bed side manner & failed to explain or prepare me for the procedure & I ended up feeling the need to apologise for not being relaxed enough.  
These procedures are not pleasant at the best of times, but to be made to be felt I was in the wrong wasn’t nice.

title: Prompt service and understanding
body: The Doctor phoned and was very understanding about my condition and recommended and made the appointment to see the Physiotherapist while I was on the phone, to attend the Dorking surgery.

title: Excellent Care
body: I recently had a kidney  operation.l visited Sanderson Suite as a day case ,as always from arrival to being discharged l received excellent  care by everyone Thank you so much .

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: Help with my specific problem and follow up was excellent. Communication with practice was very prompt. The doctor managing my problem contacted me directly several times.

title: Excellent, reassuring care
body:
Having suffered heart palpitations followed by a few days of feeling exhausted and unwell I got in touch with Harvey House practice and received a call the same day from a GP. He quickly arranged same day blood tests and an ECG and health check for the following day. Later that second afternoon I received a call from a GP to go through the results. He took time to go through everything in detail and was kind, thoughtful and reassuring, and we agreed on medication to tackle one thing shown up by the blood tests. After blood pressure monitoring for a week I received another call to discuss the results. Again, that same GP was informative and empathetic and we once again agreed on medication to tackle this second issue, as well as on a referral to a specialist to check on any potential underlying causes. I have nothing but praise (and gratitude) for the way I have been looked after recently. Contrary to what I had feared because of the pressure we all know the NHS is under, I have been treated with both generosity of time and spirit, all
Of which has helped to ease my worries. On the basis of my experience I would not hesitate to recommend Harvey House. Thank you.

title: Fantastic; helpful, caring and efficient
body:
I arrived at A&E with intense ongoing pain in hand and arm. Three nights without sleep. GP had already diagnosed possible CTS.
I was assessed immediately by a nurse. Within 2 minutes was checked more closely by another nurse. In less than 5 minutes was seen by a junior/trainee doctor who listened, checked with a colleague then gave advice and printed information. Also fitted a firm brace - which has definitely helped. 
Altogether a positive, reassuring experience even though the pain continues as I wait for orthopaedic appointment.
Also a clean, pleasant environment with due privacy and understanding.
My husband had to drop me off as he went in search of parking. Three different people he spoke to were extremely helpful in enabling him to find me - they were able to track exactly where I was in the hospital system.
Thank you to everyone involved. Real teamwork!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Let down multiple times
body: Horrified with the service 111 provides. Twice ı have called in past 6 months and being extremely let down. The first time my 6 month old was in alot of distress with very lethargic ı phone at 7pm to be told a doctor would phone me back in an hour, there was no phone call and they phone at 4am. Second time ı called my 16month old had a temperature of 40.0° again very lethargic ı phoned to be told somone would call back in an hour. 45 mins they phone for them to use an app to determined wether ı should be going to hospital with my daughter. To be paid that amount of money to use an app, anyone can do that. I will never be phoning 111 again and next time will be taking my daughter straight to a and e. Parents know their children best and all children are diffrent therefore a silly app on ur phone can not be reliable for a professional opinion

title: Excellent
body: Been with this surgery for a year and I can't fault it, excellent service, phones answered swiftly and never a problem speaking to a clinician and being seen

title: Long waiting times
body:
I requested an appointment online at 8 weeks pregnant and waited over the advised 48 hours for them to contact me with a booking appointment. After my telephone booking appointment I then had to wait a week for my scan and assessment only to be told that there are no spaces for the procedure to take place at my nearest centre and that I will have to travel much further away to have the surgical abortion. This appointment again isn’t for nearly 3 weeks! By the time I finally have my termination I will be 14 weeks pregnant. The waiting times are incredibly distressing and the service does not seem to consider the effects on the woman’s mental health. 
On a positive note, all members of staff have been incredibly kind and polite. I’m now in the process of phoning every day to check for cancellations as the wait is just unbearable. I hope I never have to rely on this very stretched and flawed service again.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Perfect
body: I dropped in and was seen in 25 minutes. To be frank, my treatment was absolutely superb.  Efficient,  informative,  direct and results-focused, the service perfectly met my needs. I was given an injection and a course of treatment  on-the-spot. Very very happy with my treatment and it was a 100% positive experience!

title: Professional and caring service
body: I attended A&E after a fall due to my own fault. I appreciate the pressures of not just A&E staff but throughout the NHS and did not want to add to their work load. In saying this the paramedics, staff in A&E, X-ray and Plaster Care were exceptional. I felt very reassured when in a lot of pain and just want to say a huge thank you and I apologise for adding to your work load that evening/morning.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Need to get their act together
body:
In recent months my mobile registered a total of 350 attempts to contact the Surgery. 
I abandoned the first attempt after 30mins on hold, the second time they had run out of triage call backs, in fact in the last 8 months i've managed to get one face to face appointment. 
Now a new 'Clinical System, ( i read that as computer) installation was stared some weeks ago, and the Practice is shut from May 17th - June 6/7th. Unless the call is urgent you are advised to go to a Pharmacists or Walk-in Centre. What do they class as urgent !!?? I suspect anyone having to contact the Practice with the performance i went through would feel its urgent!
Patient care is seriously flawed at the moment!

title: Excellent customer service
body: Reception staff have gone above and beyond to make sure I get the correct medical care when I've called for an appointment. They are kind, empathetic and keep you updated on what will happen.

title: Listen please
body:
First off, I would like to thank the practice staff for your work in getting medication for my wife who was released from hospital last week. Due to the delayed nature of her discharge from St Peters some of the meds she should have brought home were used in hospital while others were issued from ward stock so she had too little of some meds and too much of others. For one in particular she had only a four day supply so I endeavoured to get more via Studholme. My lack of understanding of the prescription process led to some difficulties which your staff overcame! However, although I was only asking for one medication you sent requests to Boots for all 6 on her list to be issued! This resulted in the issue of some expensive drugs of which we already had more than was required. I will, of course, return the excess medication to Boots, but I'm sure handling charges will have been incurred. I feel that if someone had actually listened to my request rather than making assumptions this situation could have been avoided.

Secondly, while I understand the doctors and other staff are operating under unprecedented pressure, not everyone who phones the surgery wants to make an appointment and a separate line for enquiries would serve both patients and staff well.

author: VS1989
title: I would not hesitate in recommending the unit
body:
I chose Peterhead to give birth in as I had heard good things about the unit, I was supported by the midwife I had seen throughout my pregnancy and a student who had requested to be at my birth and they were absolutely brilliant.  
Unfortunately because I was not progressing I had to be transferred to Aberdeen but it was so nice that the student midwife came with me to Aberdeen and stayed right through till after my baby was born, just having a face that I knew there was really comforting and she did such a good job of keeping me calm.  
We had issues with breastfeeding after being discharged so one of the midwives visited us at home every day and spent hours helping with our breastfeeding problems and giving reassurance.  
Myself and my husband were blown away with the time and effort put into helping us and being our first baby we were so grateful for all the help. Knowing that we could pick up the phone day or night if we needed was so reassuring. If it hadn't been for the support I received from the staff at PCMU (Peterhead Community Maternity Unit) I really don't know if I would have managed to keep going with breastfeeding.  
I met so many of the staff throughout my pregnancy and aftercare and every single one went above and beyond. I would not hesitate in recommending the unit to anyone and will definitely be back if the situation arises in the future.

title: Exceptional Service
body: I don't understand the negative reviews here. I have been a patient since 2017 and have been well looked after. Since Covid-19 I have been using the AskMyGP service and the surgery has NEVER failed to help me or answer my query. Usually I get a reply within a couple of hours. I'm aware of the opening times for AskMyGP and so I stick to those. In fact I feel this service saves time for me as well as the service. Thank you.

title: Incomparable care
body:
My dad,George Robinson, was admitted 14/04/22 .died 20/04/22. From the moment he was admitted the care he received was the best I have ever experienced. The staff were amazing, so informative and straight talking. Never once did they have to rush off for dads notes - no matter who I asked or what I was asking, they answered quickly and clearly with such empathy. I have never witnessed a group of people working together so well as a team. Every member of staff had such a great rapport with one and other, this made the patients feel comfortable, cared for and safe. Entering end of life care was clearly a regular occurrence on this ward. It was dealt with with the greatest respect for my dad and my brother and I. They were 100% the most friendly group of people I have ever met and I can not thank them enough for the amazing quality of care my dad received the last 6 days of his life. 
Thank you thank you thank you x love from David and Karen xxx

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rude uncompassionate reception
body:
Visited the Cumberland on 15th May with my 6 year old son who had been bitten by a horse and was in pain/ broken skin/ upset. Pharmacist advise suggested cumberland or 111. As I was near the cumberland centre i started there but received only what I can call a robotic and frosty response from reception,  unwilling to engage in a human level conversation. Please remember not everyone is a drunk or a time waster and that reception is the first impression people receive. When you approach two receptionists who seem primed to deal with such people, it's very offputting and unhelpful. Trying to be a good mum  do the right thing for my son and not waste their time I left and called 111. I was given a very helpful response and told treatment would be necessary  so to return to the cumberland. She stressed i should inform them a referral is being sent across. I tried to start the conversation by explaining my 111 information to the second receptionist and again received the same frosty robotic response, interrupting me for  information before pointing me to sit down. I said I wasn't sure if she had heard that I'd been told to tell her about the referral. She wasn't interested at all and said you'll be treated like everyone else. At no point was I expecting any different and was simply trying to do what I'd been advised to do from 111 (where I'd provided much more information than to reception).

After being told my son would have to wait 3.5 hours to see someone, my daughter and husband had returned home. Is it really so difficult to use a few more words and actually engage with patients? Perhaps you'll see triage within 30 minutes and then will wait for further treatment if necessary.  My son probably saw triage within 20 minutes. An extremely friendly lady who spoke to my son and put him at ease. She sought a second opinion and we left within 10 minutes after basic treatment. She gave a very scared 6 year old a great impression of the NHS.

 It wasn't busy,  in fact in the time we were there perhaps one other person came in. I can see how some people wouldn't bother coming back after the reception  received. Please remember you are dealing with humans. You might not like your job, you probably have to deal with lots of difficult people but it's not necessary to treat everyone the same.

title: professional but caring
body:
Everyone were very nice to us .Staff explained everything they were doing.
When my eye settled down I realised that I could see more without my glasses than with them.
     Thank you.

title: Good
body:
Moved to the area three years ago, I did hear some bad reviews about this surgery but they couldn't be further from the truth in my experience.
Excellent service from reception and Doctors, Nurses, always seem willing to help and do a bit extra for you.
Very impressed

title: Phlebotomy department - excellent service all…
body: I took my 21 year old daughter for blood tests again this morning, she is petrified of all this sort of thing and gets herself very uptight. The recepitionist clearly recognised my daughters nerves, we waited almost no time which helped her not get more uptight. The nurse who took her bloods (same nurse as last time) was beyond patient and kind. I am not allowed to mention her name (in all fairness they are all great) but wanted the generic thank you to be registered. We both really appreciated your kindness & patience. So, thank you

title: Great service from a wonderful practice
body: When ringing for appointment or repeat prescription when in a queue on the phone you only wait a short time to speak to someone, even when there are maybe 20 waiting. The staff are very helpful and always do their best to help. Good reliable Doctors who care about all their patients.

title: Very poor
body: Rang regarding my 9 month old baby coughing and having a rattely chest and breathing heavy, rang at 10am to still have no response by 8pm. Very poor especially when it comes to babies.

title: Extremely poor service
body: Receptionists rude and always directing me to see pharmacists . Practically impossible to see a GP , "due to covid " how is that possible,  they didn't help me in any way when I caught covid , the only advice I got was : if symptoms get worse call emergencies ! Still waiting to see a physiotherapy.  Recently relied on walk in centre instead of my GP for a severe sciatica . A real let down this surgery ! I wish I knew what the GPs are getting up to every day , I doubt it is serving the community!

title: Very good service from lovely staff
body: My mum was cared for and is on the way to hesl and recovery from a liver abcess after days of treatment. Lovely gentle staff all round. Nice quiet backdrop and views or rural landscape.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor Management
body: Left a&e with my daughter to go home after 6.5 hours of waiting still not having been seen.  Witnessing people who had been there 10 hours without any communiction. Asked for pain relief 3 hours earlier and was still waiting when i left. I wont blame the staff as they are not too blame but disgraceful management.

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Ultra sound
body: Very professional , lovely staff , put me at ease straight away, no waiting seen shortly after arriving .

title: Radiology Department
body: I attended an ultrasound appointment at Bishop Auckland hospital in May 2022, following referral by my gp 48 hours before. I am extremely grateful for the care and attention I received, and unequivocally commend the thoroughness and professionalism of the staff directly concerned. There is a carefully structured appointments system which works extremely well if we, the general public, respect and adhere to it. Once I had found the department (better signage just inside the main entrance?), my patient experience was extremely positive - well done!

title: Excellent patient focussed professional care
body: From the greeting by a volunteer at the entrance to the receptionist and the clinical services within the Dermatology Department my experience has been exceptional at Cromer Hospital and at the fabulous new McMillan Unit.  I would like to thank all those involved in my treatment and care for making me feel welcome and at ease.

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body:
My experience with this clinic was really good.

Great service 

Polite and friendly staff

Neat and clean

title: Amazing staff
body: I been looked after at FPH by various staff members from various wards yesterday (A&E, DSU, Early pregnancy Unit and Theatre 4 to be more specific) and I can not write enough about how grateful I am for the care I have received. From the porters, to care assistants, to Nurses, ODP’s, Doctors, theatre staff, they were all so empathic, so caring, so dedicated that I will be grateful forever to you all. My story was not with a happy ending sadly but your compassion made me get through it in a much positive way. I know how busy you all are and I honestly applaud you for everything you do!

title: Excellent Team at Practice
body: Excellent response to any enquiry the time frame is very fast , we as patients must also allow for what is going on that we are not aware of. Never had a problem that has not been dwelt with. Excellent service all the time.

title: Request of Medication
body: Having requested a repeat prescription and contacted the surgery on a number of occasions. After several days, still not issued no one availability to prescribe.

title: Local Surgery
body: Once again the practice delivered excellent care through the whole process, my visit was a general review of my health and a look into my ears in preparation for a hearing test.

title: Happy Patient
body: I recently saw a doctor at the Conisbrough practice . The Doctor put me at ease and explained everything about my medication .He was very friendly and I felt I could relax me and answer the questions he asked me.I am 86 year old and he made me feel like a person and not someone who is unable to understand. My daughter accompanied me and the doctor made sure she also understood about my condition and how I had to take my medication.

title: Happy Patient
body: I recently saw a doctor at the Conisbrough practice . The Doctor put me at ease and explained everything about my medication .He was very friendly and I felt I could relax me and answer the questions he asked me.I am 86 year old and he made me feel like a person and not someone who is unable to understand. My daughter accompanied me and the doctor made sure she also understood about my condition and how I had to take my medication.

title: Superstars
body:
I was asked to have my GP complete and sign an occupational form as part of my application to the Met, and was given a quick turnaround to get this completed by. 

The practice went above and beyond to be as helpful and accommodating as possible and couldn’t be more grateful for their help. They always treat patients with a smile and positive attitude. Thank you!!!

title: Excellent practice
body: My doctor at the Doctors House was very patient when listening to my concerns and referred me for the correct tests and this has always been the case when I am treated at this practice. The doctor has always been very helpful and caring.

title: Badly organised, under funded
body:
Ever since I joined the surgery seven years ago I have been underwhelmed on many occasions.  Sometimes it is the quality of the doctor, sometimes the chaotic nature of process and communication and always the difficulty of getting through to the surgery.  

They have no call queuing system and say it is too expensive to put in.  Phones ring out unanswered and with no voicemail.  The web site is confusing and underused.   The surgery itself is depressing and needs updating.  

Other local surgeries have call queuing, smart new buildings and seem to be better organised but you can't transfer to them as their lists are closed.

On the positive side some of the GPs are excellent - unfortunately I am unable to name them according to the rules of this site.

title: Too many cooks spoil the broth
body: Last week a pharmacist from the practice telephoned me in regard to medication that had been supplied erratically at best. This was the third pharmacist to contact me in four weeks. On the previous two occasions, the problem was said to be sorted out and won't occur again—clearly famous last words. The problem with this is simple: three pharmacists should not be involved for a month trying to sort one problem out; too many cooks spoil the broth and I don't get my medication. It is unacceptable all round and does not help provide a more patient focused service.

title: Contemptuous staff
body:
Staff refused to deal with the queue because we had the audacity to enter the waiting room at 08:02. It open at 8! The receptionist stayed in her seat and ignored us standing there, when she finally acknowledged our existence we were forced to shout responses to her across the room, personal details, name address date of birth, contact numbers, next of kin! Really! 
Absolutely no sense of urgency in this place.

title: Poor Service
body: Lack of continuation of care - constantly re-telling trauma and issues to different therapists. Therapy was terminated by letter from them due to my sporadic attendance. Zero phone call to discuss and when I asked to complain was consistently ignored.

title: Wonderful doctor
body: My family and I have been with this practice for the last 17 years and we have never felt let down by the doctors. The care that has been provided to my family has always been amazing. Unfortunately, there are occasions where some of the receptionists do not sound like they are willing to help and are sometimes not willing to listen properly. It is difficult to get an appointment at times but this is understandable and once we manage to get an appointment we always receive the best care.

title: Waiting times way too long
body: Even in third world countries you don't wait more than 2 hours to be seen by a doctor... Talking to someone in the waiting area of A&E, that person was waiting for more than 7 hours to be seen, and we've been waiting for at least 6... Nice friendly staff, but you make us think you're doing this because you're hoping we give up and leave... Some people have babies at home, can't stay up all night waiting and then go home and stay awake all day too and be fine. Think about that too when you prioritize your work.

title: rubbish non existant service
body: Called with serious issue- waited to get   through their automated phone system- took ten minutes to reach the reception after loads of messages that were not relevant- then it says we are busy call another time and hung up- how about offering the chance for a call back without the ten minute wait- or someone answer the phone??

title: Very bad
body: I have been trying to get a gp appointment for last 9 months. Every time I try get an appointment on the app it doesn’t let me and every time I call in at 8:00 there is no appointment and most of the time I would have to wait 20 min or so for anyone to pick up and the phone just hangs up. It’s unreliable  and there is never appointment when you do get through to a receptionist. The receptionist are rude and don’t help with any alternative to book you in for a near date.you can’t even book an appointment for a further date. You just have to keep calling. Worst go practice ever!!!!

title: Worlds busiest GP!!
body: Can never ever get through the phone. Almost impossible. It will state user busy. Furthermore, I have gone to the GP my self stood outside and rang the GP the phones are switched off and phones are not ringing and receptionist just sitting there. This is so frustrating to see, As you spend all morning to get an appointment. Then drive down to see that the phones not even ringing all appointments gone within a few minutes which is again impossible. They must make 60 appointments a minute over the phone??? Everyone knows it’s Covid time it’s not even the point this GP still exactly the same as it is now even before Covid. Absolutely disappointed with this GP. Used to be good many many years ago.

title: Can't get an appointment
body: This surgery now has only 2 Doctors and is clearly struggling which is a shame.  When I joined the surgery 6 years ago I felt they were a lovely little practice but due to staffing issues they are really letting down their patients. Been trying to get an appointment and have no given up.  Looking at taking my family elsewhere as although we don't need healthcare often I want to feel that I can get an appointment and be cared for without the need to go to A & E.  This Surgery has so much potential and it's a shame they are letting down their patients. This is how serious problems go undiagnosed.

title: Felt invisible
body:
2 days later and I still don’t know if the op was successful. Felt too ill to ask questions before I left but was told there was info in a pack.
There was sheet not filled out! Tried to ring but still waiting for nurse to get back to me. I thought I was speaking to a nurse when I phoned who was giving me vague advice, then found out she was the ward secretary. 
I have absolutely no idea what’s happening.
Never had any problems with NHS and will be staying with them in the future.
Well done NHS

title: Excellent and efficient service
body: I was referred to Newmedica in Ipswich in August last year due to a bad cataract in my left eye and a smaller on in my other eye. I was accessed and an appointment was made to have the operation in September.  The operation was very quick with no problems at all. On visiting my optician a month later it was agreed that due to the great vision difference now between my eyes that the other cataract should be done which happened in December. Once again the appointment was made in Ipswich and the operation carried out with no problems. In January this year I found that the vision in my right eye was not as clear as my left eye, I contacted Newmedica and went to their Bury St Edmunds clinic to have it checked. They said that everything seemed to be ok and that the vision should return to normal in a few weeks. This has now happened and both eyes give the same accuracy of vision which is clear and provide very good vision at distance, I only now need reading glasses for close up work. I found my whole experience with Newmedica very satisfying, I was thinking that these operations could take months or longer to complete but they seem to have the process very well organised and I can't praise them enough.

title: Brilliant service offered by the Gynaecology team
body:
I cannot praise enough the high quality care I received from the Gynaecology team at Stepping Hill Hospital this morning.
The Gynaecologist was on time, explained the process to me and encouraged me to ask questions. She introduced me to the team of excellent nurses who made me feel comfortable and very relaxed.
The investigations were done by my Gynaecologist very efficiently and the team worked cohesively.
Despite the constraints of NHS, this team delivered an excellent service. Thank you

title: Positive healthcare experience
body: I wanted to thank the Diagnostic Imaging team after my visit today. Despite what appeared a hectic Monday morning for them  they  were professional, warm, and friendly throughout all my interactions with them.

title: Excellent, authentic, takes initiative.
body:
Saw my GP's registrar and she couldn't have been more helpful. Picked up various issues other than the one I had presented with (which was fine). Am now on NHS diabetes prevention programme and in the system with Conquest Hospital for potential operation.
We have been with the practice for 7 years and are very happy with it.

title: Amazing team
body: I just wanted to leave a message to say a massive thankyou to childrens ane, pederatic assessment unit and skarlark ward. All 3 teams were amazing I really could not be more thankful and grateful for everything you did this weekend for my newborn and supporting me through such a scary time. You really are all amazing and your efforts patience and time did not go unnoticed could not speak more highly of all the staff. Thankyou

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful appointment set up
body: Rang off mobile phone at 8am, got through to 6th in the queue and it slowly worked down until I was next. However felt it was off when I was still next caller after 15 mins so attempted to call off my partners to phone and got through to 30th. That queue continued to go down to 20th in the queue (by this point on hold as next patient for 35 mins). Someone finally answered the initial call to say no appointments. Tried to explain how I’d been on hold at next caller but the other phone calling the same number was moving down the queue and receptionist was extremely rude and not one bit bothered! How is it possible to ring the same number and have 2 different call queues where one isn’t being answered! Gp surgery has majorly gone down hill in the last few years and now a bit of a joke!

title: Lovely helpful staff
body: One issue, people should be made more aware of the app/website to book an appointment instead of stressing on phone from 8am.

title: Feel worse
body: I was so poorly and in pain when I rang for an appointment. The receptionist have absolutely no compassion. I actually came off the phone in tears after how I was spoken to. No appointments available or telephone consultations. I just feel sorry for anyone with mental health issues that need a friendly, sympathic ear. I certainly felt like I was the one in the wrong for even considering wanting to see a doctor. Some staff training on empathy deffinately needed at this surgery.

title: Yearly review
body: My appointment was for a yearly review, I was called in on time and was treated in a thorough and pleasant manner, full marks to the practitioner

title: Great practice
body: We changed to Conisbrough group practice because of ongoing issues with our daughter not being take seriously and they have been both professional and thorough when we have visit we are much happier at this practice

title: Disappointing!
body: Poor experience. No call back after requesting  an emergency appointment as I’m pregnant! Then to be told a week and half later that i should have call back if i dont hear from them. How do i know your process if it wasnt explained??? Always being told to contact the midwife even though its clear GP have responsibilities towards me until week 26! Went for whooping cough vaccine, the nurse didnt know that you can now have them from week 16 instead of week 18 even though its on the nhs website “we have not officially been told” she said. They still don’t do face to face appointments. It’s ok until you may need a physical examination then its just their guess work or dr. google. Shocking

title: Helpful staff
body:
I had to call in for an appointment which was urgent. I could hear how stressed the receptionist was as I am sure she expected me to be rude or curt. I am sure every call is stressful.
However, I knew she would be doing her best for me in these stretched times.
I was polite and cooperative, and her tone changed. She knew I was not going to be horrible.
She was very helpful, getting me an appointment in 3 weeks with my gp, and an emergency appointment in 3 days. She was efficient, effective and I could hear how glad she was that I was not abusive.
Please know, we are not all abusive. Some of us out here just need help.
She knew this and was an angel. I am very grateful to her as I am worried about the thing that caused me to call. 

Keep going, team. We DO appreciate you!!

title: Disgusting
body: Busy tone for over an hour, no option to even wait in the queue. Seems like the phone is taken off the hook, why have a telephone service if it never works. Put all options online and make it easier for us.

title: Service has gone down
body:
I've been with this surgery for many many years and its so sad to say how the service given to patients has dropped.  I've never had issues previously with booking appts, the doctors have been excellent and receptionists always very helpful.  But recently its been a nightmare, firstly it takes over an 1 hour to get through and ask for an appt by that time all appts are gone, only to be told by receptionist that you can come in at 8am or 1pm to book an appt, I think its quite unreasonable to ask someone who is unwell to come in to make an appt, clearly they would not be calling for an appt if they were well.  Receptionist was rude and no empathy at all, I repeated something twice as she was not listening to me and she goes on to tell me I'm not professional.  I told her I appreciate what she is saying and I also work in the same environment and there is a way of how you speak to patients, I understand its not her fault but I have been trying for 3 weeks to get an appointment.  When I asked if I could leave a message for the doctor she refused saying its her job to book the appt not the GPs, I'm not asking the GP to book an appt but to merely leave a message for him.. Practice's are constantly promoting patient wellbeing but its unfortunate that reception staff don't seem to have the basic emotions or skills on how to speak to a patient. From someone who is struggling with mental health currently this does not help me at all. What worries is me how vulnerable patients who have no one else to wait for them at the practice   to make an appt are being treated.  I understand the pandemic has not helped matters but having worked myself throughout the pandemic I have always done my upmost to help patients as its not been easy for anyone.
But the Doctors and Nurses at Summerfield have always been caring and helpful.
Reception staff however need some training on some basic skills.

title: general incomprehension
body: I have no idea what has happened to a once great general practice, but am having immense difficulty coping with it.  Recently I was given a telephone appointment to discuss a condition I do not have and medication I do not take.  After twice having tried to ring the surgery, only to have the call terminate after long waiting periods, I decided to wait for the call.  Received a message confirming the call and the next day a message confirming an appointment I had not made to go the surgery during the same hour I was expecting the phone call.  I tried ringing the surgery again, only to be cut off, yet again, after holding on for 18 minutes.  To say this is all extremely stressful is putting it far too mildly

title: Appointment
body: Tried calling for appointment today .it took me 30 mins to actually get in queue and another 30 mins to talk to receptionist.  Lion health should be open now so patients can come in surgery as before covid. We are told we have to live with covid and everything else is back to normal.

title: If 0 stars were possible this doctor's surgery…
body: If 0 stars were possible this doctor's surgery would get 0. Worst doctors in town. You have to ring about 300 plus calls to get through to the receptionist who have alot of attitude when dealing with your call. This is just one section of the problem the doctor is even worse when talking to the doctor about an issue regarding your health you are interrupted by the doctor who will not even listen to your full symptoms and then turn around and say i have another appoitment book can you hurry up. The worst perfessional doctor ever.

title: An unsatisfactory experience
body:
My surgery has offloaded all its MSK cases to you. I have had had three successive physio appointments, (one by telephone and two in person of 10 mins and 3 mins respectively) each one months apart. In all of that time I have only received a youtube video and told to perform exercises, some of which were completely impractical for me. The physio appointments can best be described as cursory and I was sent an app which, despite ringing twice, I could not open as my details were not recognised. (Probably because my name was spelt incorrectly in the email sent to me). Also, the first in person appointment was largely taken up by my repeating the information I had already supplied in the online pre-appointment questionnaire.
I have now been passed on to another member of the "team" (not a doctor or consultant themselves) and will incur another 6 week wait. The purpose of that appointment is not clear, but the outcome, if any, will presumably result in another lengthy delay.
So, including my inital appointment with my doctor, I will have had (and waited for) 5 appointments over 9 months and I still will not have been seen by a specialist. My particular issue was never going to be resolved with exercises but I have to go through the pretence that it will be. I am still not on any appropriate waiting list, but I guess that is the whole point of this exercise.     
The service is about as impersonal and minimalist as health care can get. No one is overseeing or in charge of progressing patients' cases. Your grandiloquent overview statement proclaims that your service is consultant-led but there is no evidence of that as far as I can see.
Can you give me a realistic estimate of how long it will be before I receive any treatment?

title: Dreadful
body:
I echo the poor reviews already given.
A number of letters written to practice manager and partners, however to-date not even the courtesy of a response.
Appointments given weeks in the future which has necessitated non emergency visits to hospital.
Reception: On occasion courteous and professional, however the opposite is true more often than not.

author: giraffexw63
title: Dignity during what is a vulnerable time for any woman
body:
I was induced at the PRM (Princess Royal Maternity Hospital) earlier this year to give birth to my first child. I was incredibly well looked after during the induction process right through to my transfer to labour ward.  
In labour ward things progressed very quickly. I was looked after by student midwife Nichola and a qualified midwife. The care given by both midwives was exemplary and it is hard to believe Nichola was a student, she was kind, extremely professional and reassuring.  
I found the process overwhelming and difficult particularly as my baby went into distress and we had to be taken to theatre for delivery but the care given by the midwifery team was excellent and at no point did I feel myself or my baby were at risk due the calm nature of the midwives and doctors.  
I also wanted to say thank you for the midwives for affording me a great deal of dignity during what is a vulnerable time for any woman - they are a credit to the profession!

title: Support with application form
body: The team at Trevellyn House has been so supportive in getting a form completed abd signed off by the Doctors for a license application, great communication of timing, cost awareness and supportive throughout! Thank you for taking time out to support and making the whole experience easy and quick!

title: What a Nightmare
body: You call you doctors for an appointment, to start with just to get through is a challenge, you then are added to a waiting list that can be over an hour wait! You choose the option for a call back when at position 1 - i then get a missed call, no ring just shows missed call so i have to go through all the process again. Finally get through- 1h 20 minutes later- no appointments available- you will need to call again tomorrow. This is the modern world we live in.

title: Expert Service.
body: I was referred to the Eye Hospital by West Middlesex Hospital for what was diagnosed as conjunctivitis. I was seen, examined and treated in just over an hour by skilled expert professionals in A&E. My only complaints are regarding the form one had to fill in which was lengthy and took time to complete (particularly if one has impaired vision) and the rather run-down building which is old and needs refurbishing.

title: No problems in over 20yrs with this practice
body: Unlike a fair few reviewers on various sites I can honestly say I have NEVER had  problem with reception staff and have found ALL the doctors very pleasant and friendly,I am bed bound and unable to leave house due to my illness and the doctors come out to see me when needed,only problem lately has been a week or so wait to actually get a call back phone consultation with the doctors but this may well be down to impact of covid.I am very happy with my doctors.

author: augustxt55
title: The staff were very good with me
body:
Was extremely anxious about the fitting but the staff were very good with me. Immediately calmed me down and were very patient.  
Everything was explained clearly and all my questions were answered in a clear none technical way. Thank you.
